bibl.title: Letter from H.M. Smith to J.E.S. Thorpe, September 9, 1919

div1.p: Smith recommends a species of top minnow for mosquito control, as well as useful publications dealing with mosquitos.

div1.head: Letter from H.M. Smith to J.E.S. Thorpe, September 9, 1919
div1.opener:
R. E. Coker.
COPY
File
Mufitt
Tallassee
U. S. BUREAU OF FISHERIES
DEPARTMENT OF COMMERCE
Washington, September 9, 1919
Mr. J. E. S. Thorpe,
General Superintendent
Tallassee Power Co.,
Badin, N. C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p: I wish to acknowledge the receipt of your letter of September 3.

While nearly all small fish are destructive of mosquito larvae,
the Bureau cannot recommend to you any species as being more effec-
tivei in this respect than the common top minnow, Gambusia affinis,
which should be entirely suitable to the waters of your vicinity.
We are enclosing, however, a copy of our economic circular No. 17.

The efficiency of small fish in controlling the breeding of
mosquitoes depends, of course, to a very large extent upon the
maintenance of proper conditions in the water, especially along
the shores. I have no doubt that Dr. Carter has already suggested
to you the necessity of keeping the shore waters as free as possible
from floating debris and vegetation that rises above the surface of
the water. Certain grasses that grow partly in and partly out of
the water seem to be very favorable to the breeding of mosquitoes
notwithstanding the presence of fish. It sometimes occurs, too, that
the leaves of pond lilies, after the stems die, become so sunken in
the center as to form isolated cups of water within which the mos-
quitoes larvae are entirely safe from attack by fish.

Doubtless the Bureau of Public Health Service has already sup-
plied you with a copy of their separate No.327, from Public Health
Report 21, of May 23, 1919, comprising an article on Fishes in Re-
lation to Mosquitoes in Ponds, by S. F. Hildebrand, a representative
of this Bureau. If not, and you will address us again in the matter,
we can send you a copy of our edition of the same paper which is expected
to be available within a couple of weeks.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, H. M. SMITH
Commissioner.
